s.text: During the preparation of this manuscript, a similar study using a recombinant Ad-mIL-4 vector for treatment of murine CIA was reported [ 31].
The ability of Ad-mIL-4 to treat established CIA was evaluated by local periarticular and systemic intravenous injection of Ad-mIL-4 into mice at various times after disease onset.
The ability of Ad-mIL-4 to treat established CIA was evaluated by local periarticular and systemic intravenous injection of Ad-mIL-4 into mice at various times after disease onset.

Disease severity was monitored every other day using an established macroscopic scoring system ranging from 0 to 4: 0, normal; 1, detectable arthritis with erythma; 2, significant swelling and redness; 3, severe swelling and redness from joint to digit; and 4, maximal swelling with ankylosis.

In contrast, it is possible that the therapeutic effects of IL-4 after local injection are conferred in part by IL-10.

Gene therapy represents a novel approach for delivery of therapeutic agents to joints in order to treat the pathologies associated with RA and osteoarthritis, as well as other disorders of the joints.

Gene therapy represents a novel approach for delivery of therapeutic agents to joints in order to treat the pathologies associated with RA and osteoarthritis, as well as other disorders of the joints.

Gene therapy represents a novel approach for delivery of therapeutic agents to joints in order to treat the pathologies associated with RA and osteoarthritis, as well as other disorders of the joints.

Whereas the immunized control mice, injected with Ad-eGFP, showed disease onset on day 3 after lipopolysaccharide injection, Ad-mIL-4-treated mice showed a delay in disease onset and as a reduction in the total number of arthritic paws.
We have demonstrated that both local and systemic administration of Ad-mIL-4 resulted in a reduction in the severity of arthritis, as well as in the number of arthritic paws.

Disease severity was monitored every other day using an established macroscopic scoring system ranging from 0 to 4: 0, normal; 1, detectable arthritis with erythma; 2, significant swelling and redness; 3, severe swelling and redness from joint to digit; and 4, maximal swelling with ankylosis.
In addition, expression of IL-4 resulted in a twofold increase in the level of endogenous IL-1Ra (data not shown).
The levels of IL-4 and IL-10 expression also were examined in arthritic mice treated with Ad-mIL-4 at day 35 after injection.
The inserted cDNA sequences are expressed under the transcriptional control of human cytomegalovirus promoter.
2a) compared with the nonarthritic control joints.

IL-4, similar to tumor necrosis factor (TNF)-? and IL-1 inhibitors, has been shown be therapeutic for the treatment of murine CIA when administered intravenously as a recombinant protein, either alone or in combination with IL-10.

The paw swelling for each mouse was calculated by adding the four thicknesses of the individual paws.
